N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 638.2 - Conditions for reimbursement for energy assistance

State Regulations
(a) Energy assistance costs required to be
allocated or distributed to other programs by regulations or direction of the
department shall be claimed as so required. Such costs shall be allocated or
distributed in accordance with the requirements set forth in Part 602 of this

Title. (b) Emergency energy or
interim energy assistance costs that cannot be claimed as energy assistance
reimbursable pursuant to this Part shall be claimed in accordance with
department regulations or directives pertaining to emergency
assistance. (c) Costs relating to
energy assistance that cannot be claimed pursuant to this Part must be claimed
in accordance with other department regulations or directives for the program
or activity for which such costs may be claimed and must be claimed in
accordance with the requirements set forth in department regulations pertaining
to the allocation of expenditures for public assistance and care. (d) No portion of any claim for reimbursement
for energy assistance may be supported solely with State funds without Federal
participation if reimbursement may be claimed from a program for which Federal
participation is available. (e) Any
claims for reimbursement from any portion of an activity or program for which
there is Federal participation which were not fully reimbursed as claimed and
which were properly made at the time they were originally claimed may be
reclaimed as expenses for which Federal participation is available if such
claims were appropriate when originally submitted. This subdivision shall apply
only when the revised claim is timely and not in excess of any ceiling or
limitation for Federal participation and an adjustment to reduce the original
claim is simultaneously submitted to the department. (f) Claims for reimbursement for energy
assistance provided to eligible individuals shall not be submitted if such
claims seek reimbursement rates or amounts which are greater than otherwise
permitted by the department. (g) Except as otherwise specifically authorized by Federal or State law or
regulations or as specifically directed by the department, claims for
reimbursement for energy assistance provided to eligible individuals shall be
submitted in the manner required by such law, regulations or
directive. (h) Any adjustment of
claims for reimbursement, including adjustments to claims as a result of
recoveries or collections, shall be made in accordance with procedures, instructions or directions of the department. Notes
